Explain Pain Behind the Shoulder to a patient.

You feel an aching pain behind your shoulder, perhaps down toward the shoulder blade. The pain
 worsens when you throw, serve in tennis, or hold your arm in throwing position. Perhaps you have also
 noticed that your shoulder has become stiffer, especially when rotating your arm inward.

 Posterior shoulder pain - pain behind the shoulder - is common among throwing athletes and overhead
 sports athletes. The most common causes are infraspinatus tendinopathy ,
 internal impingement , and GIRD (glenohumeral internal rotation
 deficit). This type of shoulder pain often requires a thorough
 evaluation for proper treatment.

 The good news is that conservative treatment is effective for most people, with sleeper stretch being
 a documented effective exercise.

Explain Finger Numbness to a patient.

Numbness, tingling or "sleeping" fingers is a common symptom that can have many causes. The most
 important clinical task is to find out where the nerve is affected - in the neck, along
 the arm, or in the hand.

 The nerves that supply the hand and fingers start in the neck and run through the shoulder, arm and
 forearm before reaching the fingers. A nerve can be compressed or irritated at any point along this
 path.
Generer klinisk resonnering for cervikogen hodepine

Hodepinens karakteristikk og lokalisasjon, kombinert med cervikale funn (C1-C2 dysfunksjon, suboccipital spenning), er konsistent med cervikogen hodepine. Differensialdiagnoser inkluderer tensjonshodepine og migrene, men presentasjonen favoriserer cervikogen etiologi.

Describe FAQ for De Quervain's Tenosynovitis: Complete Guide.

FAQ

 

 
 How long does it take to recover?

 With proper treatment, most experience significant improvement within 4-6 weeks.
 Complete healing may take 3-6 months.

 

 
 Does cortisone help?

 Yes, for De Quervain's, cortisone has good effect (unlike tennis elbow). Combined with splinting, this is gold standard according
 to JAMA 2023.

 

 
 Can I continue using my phone?

 You should significantly reduce thumb use on phone during treatment period.

Describe Supine Roll Test in the context of BPPV (Crystal Disease).

Supine Roll Test

 The patient lies flat on their back and the head is quickly rolled from side to side. Tests for horizontal canal BPPV.

 

 Do I Need MRI or CT?

 In the vast majority of cases, clinical examination is sufficient. Imaging is only relevant if symptoms do not match BPPV, you have red flags (headache, neurological symptoms), or treatment fails repeatedly without explanation.

 

 
 
 6
 Treatment

 

 What Can the Chiropractor Do?

 Treatment consists of specific repositioning maneuvers that move the loose crystals out of the semicircular canal and back to the utricle where they belong.

 
 Epley Maneuver

 The most used and studied treatment for posterior canal BPPV. A meta-analysis showed symptom relief in 74-75% of patients after one treatment - over six times better than the control group. With repeated treatments, over 90% achieve improvement.

 

 Other Maneuvers

 
 Semont Maneuver: Alternative to Epley, especially useful for cupulolithiasis

 Gufoni Maneuver and Barbecue Roll: Used for horizontal canal BPPV

 

 What Can You Do Yourself?

 Once the diagnosis is confirmed and you have learned the correct technique, you can perform repositioning maneuvers at home during new episodes. Other measures that can help include vitamin D supplements if blood tests show deficiency, avoiding rapid head movements in the acute phase, and continuing normal activities as soon as possible.

 Treatment Course

 Most patients need 1-3 treatments. Median duration of symptoms is 2 weeks. Early treatment often leads to faster improvement.

 

 
 
 7
 Prognosis

 

 BPPV is a benign condition with very good prognosis. Repositioning maneuvers provide immediate improvement for most.

 Residual Dizziness After Treatment

 31-61% of patients report persistent mild dizziness or unsteadiness after successful treatment, even though nystagmus and positional vertigo are gone. This residual dizziness usually lasts a median of 10 days and typically resolves within 3 months. In some cases, this can develop into PPPD (Persistent Postural-Perceptual Dizziness).

 Recurrence Is Common

 
 Approximately 15-23% experience recurrence within the first year

 5-year recurrence rate is around 40%

 Up to 50% may experience a new episode within 5 years

 

 Prevention of Recurrence

 Vitamin D supplementation in patients with documented deficiency can reduce the risk of new episodes. A meta-analysis showed significant reduction in recurrence rate (relative risk 0.37).

 

 
 
 8
 Red Flags - When to See a Doctor

Describe Important to Understand for Nociplastic Pain: When the Nervous System Becomes Oversensitive.

Important to Understand

 

 
 THIS IS IMPORTANT

 
 Your pain is real. Nociplastic pain is not imaginary, psychosomatic, or "just in your head."

 It's not your fault. You haven't "chosen" to have this type of pain.

 It can get better. The nervous system has the ability to change back (neuroplasticity).

 Treatment takes time. This is a gradual process, not a quick fix.

 
 

 Common Misconceptions

 
 "The doctors can't find anything, so it must be psychological"

 Wrong. Nociplastic pain is a neurological condition. That the MRI is "normal" only means the cause of the pain isn't visible on the images - not that the pain is imaginary.

 

 
 "I just need to find the right practitioner who can fix me"

 With nociplastic pain, there's nothing to "fix" in the traditional sense. Treatment is about helping the nervous system function differently, and this requires active participation from you.

 

 
 "I need to rest until the pain goes away"

 Wrong approach. Prolonged rest and avoidance often reinforce sensitization. Graded, safe movement is necessary for improvement.

Provide a structured clinical overview of Persistent Symptoms After Concussion.

What is Post-Concussion Syndrome?: Post-Concussion Syndrome (PCS) occurs when symptoms after a concussion persist longer than expected. In medical terminology, the condition is defined as symptoms lasting more than 3 months after a mild traumatic brain injury. PCS is one of several causes of persistent dizziness and can resemble other vestibular conditions.

Symptoms: Often located in the back of the head, worsens with bending or exertion.

Who is Most at Risk?: Women have 2-3 times higher risk of PCS than men. Adult women have an odds ratio of 2.57 for elevated symptom burden.

Types of Dizziness After Concussion: Here, small calcium crystals have loosened from their normal position in the balance organ and ended up in the semicircular canals. Post-traumatic BPPV often behaves differently than regular BPPV - it more often affects multiple canals simultaneously and can be more resistant to treatment.

Treatment: The latest international consensus (Amsterdam 2022) has turned previous treatment advice upside down. Complete rest is outdated and can actually prolong symptoms.

Prognosis - What Can You Expect?: The good news: Most people with PCS improve over time, especially with proper treatment.

Explain Morton's Neuroma to a patient.

Despite its name, Morton's neuroma is not a true neuroma (nerve tumor) . It is a
 thickening and fibrosis of the common plantar digital nerve between the toes - one of many foot and ankle conditions we treat. The condition most often affects the
 space between the 3rd and 4th toe (66-85% of cases).

 When the nerve is subjected to prolonged pressure and irritation, scar tissue develops around the nerve
 (perineural fibrosis). Many describe the classic symptom: "like having a stone under the
 foot" or "something in the shoe."

Describe Frequently Asked Questions for Text Neck: From Mobile Use to Neck Pain.

Frequently Asked Questions

 

 What is text neck?

 Text neck is a collective term for neck pain and problems that arise from prolonged mobile phone use
 with head bent forward. When head is 60 degrees forward, load on neck increases from about 5 kg to 27
 kg.

 Can text neck cause headache?

 Yes, text neck is a common cause of cervicogenic headache. The constant load on neck muscles and joints
 can cause tension headache that starts in neck and radiates to forehead and temples.

 How long does it take to get rid of text neck?

 With the right measures, most see improvement within 2-4 weeks. Key is to change mobile habits, do
 regular exercises, and possibly get treatment. Long-standing cases may require longer rehabilitation.
 

 Which exercises help with text neck?

 The most important exercises are chin tucks (double chin), chest stretches, and shoulder blade
 squeezes. These counteract forward head posture and strengthen muscles that hold head in neutral
 position.

 Is text neck dangerous?

 Text neck is not dangerous in itself, but prolonged strain can contribute to earlier degenerative
 changes in neck. It's important to address the problem early to avoid it becoming chronic.

Describe Frequently Asked Questions for Tennis Elbow (Lateral Epicondylitis).

Frequently Asked Questions

 

 
 How long does it take for tennis elbow to heal?

 Most people (89%) experience significant improvement within 12 months with
 conservative treatment. With active rehabilitation and eccentric exercises, improvement can be seen as
 early as 6-8 weeks.

 

 
 Should I use an elbow brace/bandage?

 A tennis elbow brace can provide symptomatic relief and make it easier to function
 in daily life. It should be placed about 2-3 cm below the elbow, not over the tender spot. Use it as a
 supplement to training, not as the a key treatment approach.

 

 
 Does cortisone help with tennis elbow?

 Cortisone often provides short-term relief (2-6 weeks), but studies show a 72%
 recurrence rate. Patients who receive cortisone often have worse long-term results than those who choose
 active rehabilitation. I recommend avoiding cortisone.

 

 
 Can I continue to exercise?

 Yes, but avoid exercises that provoke pain. Pull exercises and gripping can be
 problematic. Focus on eccentric rehabilitation exercises and temporarily modify strength training.

 

 
 What's the difference between tennis elbow and golfer's elbow?

 Tennis elbow (lateral epicondylitis) causes pain on the outside
 of the elbow and affects the extensor muscles. Golfer's elbow (medial
 epicondylitis) causes pain on the inside and affects the flexor muscles. The treatment
 principles are similar.

 

 
 Do I need surgery?

 Rarely. Only 5-10% with prolonged problems (over 12 months) without...

Describe Pressure-Induced Dizziness (Hennebert Sign) in the context of Superior Canal Dehiscence Syndrome (SCDS).

Pressure-Induced Dizziness (Hennebert Sign)

 Affects 37% and is triggered by Valsalva maneuver (straining), coughing, sneezing, heavy lifting or nose blowing.

 

 Chronic unsteadiness and balance problems affect many, and up to 50% report mental fatigue and brain fog.

 Auditory Symptoms (Hearing Disturbances)

 
 Autophony

 The most characteristic symptom, affecting 42-60% of patients. Patients describe their own voice as sounding distorted or "metallic," and many hear their own body sounds abnormally loud - such as eye movements, footsteps, heartbeat and even bowel sounds. This is almost diagnostic for SCDS when present.

 

 
 Pulsatile Tinnitus: Occurs in 20-50% and is experienced as a "whooshing" sound synchronous with pulse

 Hearing Loss in Low Frequencies: Affects approximately 40%, typically in the 250-1000 Hz range

 Fullness Sensation in Ear: Reported by over 60%

 
 

 
 
 4
 Differential Diagnoses - What Can It Resemble?

 

 SCDS is called "the great imitator of the ear" because symptoms can resemble several other conditions:

 
 Meniere's Disease

 Also causes hearing loss and dizziness, but attacks come spontaneously and last 20 minutes to several hours. In SCDS, symptoms are temporally related to specific sound or pressure triggers.

Gi en strukturert klinisk oversikt over Subtil krystallsyke: Når svimmelheten ikke spinner.

Hva er subtil krystallsyke?: Subtil krystallsyke - også kalt "subjektiv BPPV" eller "Type 2 BPPV" - er den samme tilstanden som vanlig krystallsyke: Løse kalsiumkrystaller i balanseorganets bueganger sender feilsignaler til hjernen. Forskjellen ligger i hvordan symptomene oppleves.

Hvorfor standard undersøkelse mister disse pasientene: Standard undersøkelse av krystallsyke - Dix-Hallpike-testen - utføres typisk i vanlig belysning, der pasienten kan fiksere blikket. Dette undertrykker de karakteristiske øyebevegelsene (nystagmus).

Symptomene som ikke "passer inn": Fra en studie av 69 pasienter med langvarig krystallsyke (median varighet 5 år)
Hvorfor blir man så sliten?: Når balanseorganet sender feilsignaler, må hjernen jobbe overtid for å kompensere. Denne prosessen - vestibulær kompensasjon - krever betydelige nevrale ressurser.

Behandling virker - selv uten klassisk presentasjon: Det kanskje viktigste funnet: Subtil krystallsyke responderer på reposisjonsmanøvrer selv uten synlig nystagmus.

Hva kan kiropraktoren gjøre?: .

Prognose: Prognosen for subtil krystallsyke er generelt god når tilstanden først identifiseres. Behandlingssuksess på 46-90% avhengig av variant og kronisitet.

Ofte stilte spørsmål: Ja. Forskning viser at 81% av kroniske tilfeller opplever nautisk svimmelhet eller ustøhet fremfor klassisk spinning. Subtil krystallsyke er faktisk vanligere enn den klassiske varianten.

Trenger du hjelp med uavklart svimmelhet?: .

 SEEK MEDICAL HELP IMMEDIATELY IF:

 
 Sudden, intense headache ("the worst headache of my life")

 Visual disturbances, double vision, or vision loss

 Neurological deficits such as weakness, numbness, speech difficulties

 Headache after head injury

 Personality changes or confusion

Beskriv behandlingsalternativer for Horisontal Kanal BPPV.

Behandling

 

 Hva kan kiropraktoren gjøre?

 Behandling av horisontal kanal BPPV krever spesialiserte reposisjonsmanØvrer:

 
 BBQ-roll (Lempert-manåver)

 Pasienten roteres 360 grader i fire steg Ã  90 grader, med hodet hevet 30 grader. Hver posisjon holdes i 30-60 sekunder. En systematisk oversikt fra 2025 konkluderte med at BBQ-roll er en effektiv behandling. Studier viser 74% bedring etter en behandling og 85% innen tre behandlinger.

 

 
 Gufoni-manåver

 En systematisk oversikt fra 2024 med 10 studier og 1025 pasienter viste at Gufoni-manåveren er effektiv. For geotropisk variant ligger suksessraten på 71-92%, mens apogeotropisk variant har lavere respons på 63-78%. Fordelen er at den er lettere å utføre hos eldre pasienter.

 

 
 TRV-stol

 For komplekse tilfeller kan TRV-stol (en spesialisert behandlingsstol) benyttes. Denne metoden gir presisjonskontroll over hastighet, vinkel og amplitude.

 

 Behandlingsforløp - realistiske forventninger

 
 Best case (ca. 40-50%): Symptomfri etter 1-2 behandlinger. 75% er symptomfrie etter første konsultasjon

 Typisk case (ca. 30-40%): Krever 3-5 behandlinger over 2-3 uker

 Kompliserte tilfeller (ca. 15-20%): Bilateral involvering eller apogeotropisk variant kan kreve 6+ behandlinger

What is the prognosis for Fibromyalgia with Chest Pain?

Prognosis - What happens?

 

 Fibromyalgia is a chronic condition. A 10-year follow-up study (Wolfe et al., 1996) showed that 100%
 still had some symptoms, but 66% experienced improvement. Remission occurs in 17-47%
 after 1-2 years of active treatment.

 Factors that improve prognosis:

 
 
 Exercise
 The most important modifiable factor
 

 
 Early
 diagnosis and comprehensive treatment
 

 
 Sleep
 Treatment of depression and sleep problems
 

 

 For older patients, one should also be aware of osteoporosis as a
 possible additional diagnosis.

Beskriv symptomer og kjennetegn for Cervikal Foraminal Stenose - Trang Nervekanal i Nakken.

Symptomer

 

 Typiske symptomer

 
 Radikular smerte: Skarp, brennende eller elektrisk smerte som stråler fra nakke til arm

 Nummenhet og prikking: Ofte i spesifikke fingre avhengig av hvilken nerve som er påvirket

 Svakhet: Redusert kraft i spesifikke muskler i arm eller hand

 Nakkestivhet: Spesielt ved bevegelser som lukker foramen (ekstensjon + rotasjon til smertefull side)

 

 
 Spurlings test

 En klassisk test for foraminal stenose: Hodet bøyes bakover og roteres mot smertefull side, deretter trykkes lett ned. Positiv test reproduserer utstråling til armen. Dette "lukker" foramen og provoserer symptomene.

 C5-nerven (C4-C5 stenose)

 
 Smerte: Skulder og overarm

 Svakhet: Skulderløft, albuebøy

 Nummenhet: Laterale skulder

 
 

 
 C6-nerven (C5-C6 stenose)

 
 Smerte: Underarm, tommel og pekefinger

 Svakhet: Handleddsekstensjon, biceps

 Nummenhet: Tommel og pekefinger

 
 

 
 C7-nerven (C6-C7 stenose)

 
 Smerte: Bakside av arm, langfinger

 Svakhet: Triceps, handleddsfleksjon

You are a clinical documentation specialist for chiropractic. Generate accurate, professional patient explanations using correct medical terminology.
Explain treatment for Tarsal Tunnel Syndrome.

Treatment

 Moderate evidence for nerve mobilization

 Two randomized controlled trials (Kavlak 2011, El-Arahsy 2022) show that tibial nerve mobilization provides significant improvement beyond standard conservative treatment - in nerve function, pain and overall function.

 62% 
 achieved good or excellent results with conservative treatment (Fortier et al. 2022, 384 patients)

 What can the chiropractor do?

 1

 Nerve mobilization

 Controlled movements where the ankle is guided through dorsiflexion and eversion to allow the nerve to glide freely through the tunnel

 2

 Biomechanical assessment and correction

 Gait analysis, foot position assessment and orthotics for overpronation or flat feet

 3

 Manual treatment of foot and ankle

 Mobilization of subtalar and ankle joints, soft tissue treatment of calf muscles

 4

 Home exercises and self-care

 Nerve gliding exercises, calf stretches and intrinsic foot muscle training

 What can you do yourself?

 Nerve gliding exercises: 3 sets of 10-15 repetitions, 2-3 times daily

 Calf stretches: Hold 30 seconds, 3 repetitions, 2-3 times daily

 Proper shoes: Supportive shoes that correct overpronation

 Activity modification: Reduce aggravating activities during the acute phase

 Realistic expectations

 The evidence base for TTS treatment is generally of low quality . A 2024 scoping review found that only 1 of 30 studies was at evidence level 3. Approximately 40% need further intervention beyond conservative treatment.

 Surgery

 Considered after 3-6 months without sufficient improvement. Surgical decompression provides 75.3% good or excellent results . Outcomes are best when a specific cause is identified, symptoms have lasted less than 12 months, and there is minimal nerve fibrosis.

Beskriv diagnostikk — vanskelig, men mulig for Overtrening og Overbelastning.

Diagnostikk — vanskelig, men mulig

 Det finnes ingen blodprøve eller enkelttest som bekrefter overtreningssyndrom. Det er en eksklusjonsdiagnose — du må først utelukke andre forklaringer som lavt jernlager, stoffskifteproblemer, infeksjoner eller depresjon (Meeusen et al., 2013).

 Treningsdagbok

 Det enkleste og mest undervurderte verktøyet. Logg treningsbelastning (volum, intensitet, RPE), søvnkvalitet, humør og hvilepuls. Mønstrene over tid forteller mer enn et enkelt øyeblikksbilde. Apper som TrainingPeaks eller Polar Flow fungerer fint, men et enkelt regneark gjør jobben like godt.

 HRV (hjerteratevariabilitet)

 Redusert HRV kan indikere akkumulert utmattelse, men er ikke sensitiv nok alene (2024 SR). Ukentlige trender er mer informative enn enkeltmålinger. Mål konsistent — samme tidspunkt, samme posisjon, helst om morgenen. Kombinert med subjektive mål gir HRV et nyttigere bilde (Halson, 2014).

 Hviletest

 Hvis symptomene bedres etter 2–4 ukers hvile, dreier det seg sannsynligvis om NFOR. Vedvarer de, mistenkes OTS. Denne testen er kanskje den enkleste måten å skille gradene av overbelastning fra hverandre.

 Blodprøver

 CRP, ferritin, tyroidea, testosteron/kortisol-ratio og vitamin D kan støtte diagnosen og utelukke andre tilstander. Ingen av disse er diagnostiske for OTS alene, men mønsteret kan støtte diagnosen og utelukke differensialdiagnoser som anemi, infeksjon og stoffskiftesykdom (Cadegiani & Kater, 2017).

Hva forårsaker Golfalbue: Alt du trenger å vite?

Årsaker og risikofaktorer

 

 Over 90% av golfalbue-tilfeller skyldes arbeidsrelaterte faktorer - ikke golf. De vanligste Årsakene er:

 
 Repetitivt manuelt arbeid Vanligst

 Handverk som snekring, rØrlegging, maling. Repetitiv grep- og vridbevegelser over tid.

 

 
 Kontorarbeid

 Langvarig mus- og tastaturbruk, spesielt med dårlig ergonomi. Ofte kombinert med tennisalbue. Se var artikkel om musearm.

 

 
 Kastidretter

 Baseball, handball, spydkast. Repetitive kasebevegelser belaster innsiden av albuen.

 

 
 Golf (5-10% av tilfellene)

 Faktisk bare en liten andel. Vanligst hos nybegynnere med feil teknikk.

 

 Viktige risikofaktorer

 
 Repetitive grepbevegelser: Samme bevegelse tusenvis av ganger

 Tunge løft med bøyd handledd: Økter belastningen på innsiden

 Vibrasjon: Bruk av vibrerende verktøy (bormaskin, slipemaskin)

 Alder 40-60 Ør: Naturlig aldring av senevev

 Røykere: Dårligere blodtilførsel til sener

Describe treatment options for Thoracic Disc Herniation.

Treatment

 

 What Can the Chiropractor Do?

 The chiropractor's primary role in thoracic disc herniation is differential diagnosis -
 identifying the condition and assessing severity.

 
 Evidence Base

 There are no randomized controlled trials (RCTs) examining chiropractic or manual treatment
 specifically for thoracic disc herniation (ScienceDirect, 2006). Published case reports document serious
 complications after manipulation with known thoracic herniation (JAMA Neurology, 1987).

 

 For confirmed herniation without myelopathy, gentle soft tissue treatment and mobilization of surrounding
 areas may potentially relieve muscular compensation pain. High-velocity manipulation should be
 avoided when disc pathology in the thoracic spine is suspected.

 With signs of myelopathy or progressive neurological deficits, the patient should be referred
 immediately.

 
 Conservative Treatment Generally

 For patients without myelopathy, conservative treatment is recommended as first choice:

 
 Rest and activity modification: Short rest period (1-2 days) followed by gradual
 increase in activity

 Medication: Anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) after medical evaluation

 Physical therapy: Structured treatment for 4-6 weeks

 
 

 About 80% of patients return to previous activity level with conservative treatment
 (StatPearls, 2024). The classic study by Brown et al. (1992) followed 55 patients - 73% never needed
 surgery.

 Surgery

 Surgery is reserved for:

What causes Cubital Tunnel Syndrome: Everything You Need to Know?

Causes

 

 The ulnar nerve is vulnerable at the elbow for several reasons:

 
 Bent ElbowMost Common

 When the elbow is bent, the ulnar nerve is stretched and compressed. Prolonged elbow flexion (sleeping,
 phone, keyboard) is the main cause.

 

 
 Leaning on the Elbow

 Leaning your elbow on armrests, tables, or car door armrests over time puts direct pressure on the
 nerve.

 

 
 Anatomical Factors

 Some people naturally have a narrow cubital tunnel or a nerve that "jumps" out of its groove when the
 elbow bends.

 

 
 Previous Injuries

 Elbow fractures, dislocations, or arthritis can narrow the tunnel and irritate the nerve.

 

 Important Risk Factors

 
 Office work: Prolonged keyboard use with bent elbows (see also mouse arm)

 Sleeping habits: Sleeping with arms under head/pillow

 Phone use: Long conversations with bent elbow

 Rheumatoid arthritis: Can cause swelling around the nerve

 Diabetes: Increases the risk of nerve problems in general

 L5-S1 (S1-nerveroten)

 Svakhet ved å gå på tå, redusert akillesrefleks

Describe Differential Diagnoses for Trigger Points in the Neck - Muscle Knots and Referred Pain.

Differential Diagnoses

 

 It's important to distinguish trigger points from other conditions that can cause similar symptoms:

 
 Cervical Radiculopathy (Nerve Root Involvement)

 Follows dermatomal patterns (specific skin areas), often with tingling/numbness and weakness. Trigger
 points follow muscle-specific radiation patterns.

 

 
 Fibromyalgia

 Widespread pain for more than 3 months, with tenderness in many areas of the body, often with fatigue
 and sleep problems.

 

 
 Cervical Facet Joint Arthrosis

 Pain from the joints between vertebrae, often with morning stiffness that improves throughout the day.

Provide a structured clinical overview of L5.

What is L5-S1 Disc Herniation?: The L5-S1 level is the junction between the mobile low back and the rigid sacrum. Here two structures with completely different biomechanics meet, which exposes the disc to significant stress.

Why L5-S1 Specifically?: L5-S1 and L4-L5 together account for approximately 95% of all lumbar disc herniations (StatPearls 2025). These levels are also the main cause of low back pain. Several factors contribute
Symptoms of L5-S1 Herniation: With typical posterolateral herniation at L5-S1, the S1 nerve root is compressed. The symptom picture is characteristic and often causes sciatica
Differentiation: L5-S1 vs L4-L5: It's clinically important to distinguish which nerve root is affected
Diagnosis: Straight Leg Raise (Lasegue's test): Positive with pain down back of thigh/calf when leg raised between 30-70 degrees. Sensitivity: 72-97%, Specificity: 11-66%. Most sensitive for pain between 30-45 degrees.

Red Flags - When to Seek Medical Help Immediately: Cauda equina syndrome: Occurs in about 1-3% of all disc herniations. Requires surgery within 24-48 hours for best outcome.

Treatment: Most people with L5-S1 herniation don't need surgery. Conservative treatment is the first choice.

Prognosis: The prognosis for L5-S1 herniation is generally good
Frequently Asked Questions: Yes, studies show that 67% of herniations completely or partially resorb within one year. Larger herniations that protrude through the disc ring actually resorb more often than smaller bulges.

Describe Frequently Asked Questions for Neck Pain - Complete Guide to Causes, Treatment and Red Flags.

7Frequently Asked Questions

 How long do typical neck pains last?
Most acute episodes resolve within 2-6 weeks. Improvement happens fastest in the first 6-12 weeks.

 Should I wait and see if it goes away?
No, early treatment often gives better results. Treatment within 4 weeks doubles the chance of significant improvement.

 Can neck pain cause dizziness?
Yes, 43% of patients with prolonged neck pain report dizziness. Treatment of neck problems often improves dizziness.

 Do I need an MRI of the neck?
For ordinary neck pain, MRI is rarely necessary. 88.5% of healthy people have degenerative changes without symptoms.

1. Diagnose og foreslått behandling:

2. Behandlingsteknikker som kan benyttes:

   - Vanlig: Forbigående ømhet/stølhet 24-48 timer (opptil 50% av pasienter)
   - Sjelden: Hodepine, svimmelhet, tretthet
   - Svært sjelden: Alvorlige komplikasjoner (diskherniering, nerveskade, vaskulær hendelse)

4. Alternativ behandling:
   - Annen konservativ behandling (fysioterapi, medisinering)
   - Bildediagnostikk og videre utredning
   - Ingen behandling og naturlig forløp

5. Rett til å avbryte:

Describe Frequently Asked Questions for Ankle Sprains.

Frequently Asked Questions

 

 
 How long does it take for an ankle to heal?

 Grade I: 1-3 weeks. Grade II: 3-6 weeks. Grade III: 6-12 weeks or more. Healing
 time depends on the severity of the injury and how consistently you follow the rehabilitation program.
 

 

 
 Should I get an X-ray or MRI?

 In most cases, imaging is not necessary. Ottawa Ankle Rules have 97.6% sensitivity
 for detecting fractures. X-rays are only taken if there is bone tenderness over specific points or
 inability to walk four steps.

 

 
 Can I exercise with a sprained ankle?

 Modern treatment (POLICE protocol) recommends early, gentle movement within pain
 limits from day 1. Complete rest is no longer recommended. You can often continue with activities that
 don't load the ankle, such as cycling or swimming, relatively early in the process.

 

 
 How do I prevent new sprains?

 Balance training provides 35% reduction in risk of new sprains. Ankle braces or
 taping provide 69-71% reduction in previously injured athletes. Continue with strength and balance
 exercises even after the pain is gone.

 

 
 Do I need a referral to see a chiropractor?

 No, you don't need a referral. Chiropractors in Norway have had primary contact
 status since 2006, and you can book an appointment directly. If needed, the chiropractor can refer you
 for X-rays, specialist consultations, or other examinations.

 

 
 When should I seek help?

Describe causes and risk factors for Rotator Cuff — Complete Guide to the Rotator Cuff.

Causes and risk factors

 Rotator cuff injuries can be divided into two main categories: degenerative (wear over time) and traumatic (acute injury).

 Degenerative wear (most common)

 By far the most common cause. The tendons in the rotator cuff undergo natural age-related changes from around age 40. Over the years, the tendons lose blood supply and elasticity, and small micro-tears accumulate. This is a natural ageing process , not necessarily a disease.

 Acute trauma

 Sudden loading that exceeds the tendon's tolerance: falling on an outstretched arm, heavy lifting, or a forceful pull on the shoulder. Traumatic tears in younger, active individuals are an important subgroup where surgery is more often considered.

 Risk factors

 Age over 40: The prevalence increases dramatically with age. 20-25% of people in their 60s have tears (Yamamoto et al., 2010)

 Overhead work: Painters, electricians, carpenters — repetitive work with the arm above shoulder height

 Overhead sports: Handball players, swimmers, tennis players and weightlifters

 Diabetes: Increased risk of both tendinopathy and poorer healing

 Smoking: Reduces blood supply to the tendons and delays healing

 Genetics: Research suggests a hereditary component for tendon degeneration

 Dominant arm: Somewhat higher incidence on the side you use most

 Age is the greatest risk factor

 The most important thing to understand is that rotator cuff changes are part of normal ageing. The older you get, the greater the likelihood that an MRI would show changes — regardless of whether you have pain or not. This is one of the most important messages in this article.

Differential diagnoses for Neck Pain During Pregnancy?

Hormonal changes (affects all pregnant women)

 During pregnancy, the body produces the hormone relaxin , which loosens ligaments and connective tissue to prepare the body for childbirth. Relaxin levels are highest in the first trimester, but the hormone remains in the body throughout pregnancy and for several months after delivery.

Postural changes and center of gravity shift

 As the belly grows, the body's center of gravity shifts forward. To compensate, many pregnant women lean backward, leading to increased curvature in the lower back. This postural change propagates up the spine and affects the neck.

Weight gain and breast enlargement

 The natural weight gain during pregnancy - typically 10-16 kilograms - puts extra strain on all weight-bearing joints. Breasts can increase significantly in size, pulling shoulders forward and creating tension in the upper back and neck.

Sleep disturbances

 Good sleep becomes more difficult as pregnancy progresses. Many pregnant women struggle to find a comfortable sleeping position, need to get up multiple times during the night, and generally have restless sleep. Poor sleeping positions can lead to stiff and painful neck in the morning.

Describe Risks of Too Rapid Transition for Minimalist Shoes and Barefoot Training: What Does the Research Say?.

Risks of Too Rapid Transition

 

 The greatest danger with minimalist shoes is not the shoes themselves, but too rapid transition. Feet that have been "protected" in cushioned shoes for decades have weak muscles and are not prepared for the increased load.

 
 Common Injuries from Too Rapid Transition

 
 Stress fractures: Especially in metatarsal bones

 Achilles tendinopathy: Overload of the Achilles tendon

 Plantar fasciitis: Overload of the arch's connective tissue

 Muscle soreness: Intense stiffness in calves and foot muscles

 
 

 
 Why Does This Happen?

 Years of cushioned shoes have led to:

 
 Weak foot musculature (up to 17% atrophy from orthotics alone)

 Shortened Achilles tendon (from high heels)

 Reduced bone mineral density in the foot

 Loss of proprioceptive sensitivity

 
 Suddenly removing all support is like going from a cast straight to running a marathon.

URGENCY: SAFE

No red flags identified.

Clinical reasoning — why night pain does NOT mean cancer here:
- Night pain that IMPROVES with position change = mechanical cause (discogenic, facet)
- Cancer-related night pain is CONSTANT, regardless of position
- No weight loss, no appetite change, no cancer history
- Age 42 without risk factors = low pre-test probability for malignancy
- "Worse at night" is common in inflammatory/discogenic pain due to increased intradiscal pressure when supine

Provide a structured clinical overview of FAI.

What is FAI?: FAI (Femoroacetabular Impingement) , often called "hip impingement," is a
 common cause of hip pain . It is a condition where the
 shape of the hip joint leads to bone-on-bone contact in certain positions. This can
 irritate cartilage and the labrum over time.

Causes and Development: FAI morphology typically develops during adolescence (12-18 years),
 during the period of rapid bone growth. Intensive sports during this period can affect
 how the hip forms.

Symptoms: The pain is usually located in the front of the groin , but can also
 radiate to
Diagnosis: FAI is diagnosed through a combination of history, clinical examination, and imaging.

Treatment: The important UK FASHIoN study (2018) compared surgery with physical
 therapy for FAI. After 12 months, the difference was minimal - both groups improved.

Prognosis: It is still unclear whether FAI treatment prevents osteoarthritis in the long term.
 Studies are ongoing. The most important thing is to maintain good hip function and
 muscle strength.

What Is Foraminal Stenosis?: Along the entire spine, there are openings on both sides between each vertebra. They are called intervertebral foramina, and through them the nerve roots pass from the spinal cord to the rest of the body. Think of them as tunnels for the nerves.

Causes: Foraminal stenosis is almost always caused by age-related changes. The most common causes, ranked by frequency
Symptoms: Foraminal stenosis and sciatica (from disc herniation) can cause similar symptoms. Both cause radiating leg pain. But there are differences
Diagnosis: We systematically test nerve function: reflexes, strength, sensitivity and specific provocation tests. Kemp's test - where we combine backward bending with rotation toward the painful side - can reproduce the symptoms of foraminal stenosis.

Conservative Treatment with a Chiropractor: Conservative treatment is the first choice for foraminal stenosis. All guidelines recommend trying conservative treatment for 3-6 months before considering surgery (AFP, 2024).

Beskriv Ofte stilte spørsmål for Meralgia Paresthetica.

Ofte stilte spørsmål

 

 
 Er meralgia paresthetica farlig?

 Nei, meralgia paresthetica er ikke farlig. Det er en godartet tilstand som bare påvirker følelsen i huden - den gir aldri muskelsvakhet eller varige skader. De fleste blir bra med enkle tiltak.

 

 
 Kan meralgia paresthetica gå over av seg selv?

 Ja, mange tilfeller går over av seg selv når utløsende Årsak fjernes. For eksempel bedres symptomene ofte ved vekttap, løsere klær eller etter fødsel. Det kan ta uker til måneder.

 

 
 Hva er forskjellen på meralgia paresthetica og isjias?

 Meralgia paresthetica gir symptomer på fremsiden/utsiden av læret og kun følelsessymptomer. Isjias gir symptomer på baksiden av benet, kan gå helt til foten, og kan gi både smerter og svakhet. De er to helt forskjellige nerver.

 

 
 Kan jeg trene med meralgia paresthetica?

 Ja, de fleste kan trene. Unngå aktiviteter som gir mye hofteekstensjon (strekk bakover) eller langvarig standing. Sykling tolereres ofte godt fordi hoften er bøyd. Styrketrening for core og hofter kan våre nyttig.

 

 
 Må jeg opereres?

 Sjelden. 85% blir bra uten operasjon. Kirurgi vurderes først etter flere måneder med konservativ behandling uten effekt. De fleste trenger aldri kirurgi.

Describe 2. Cervicogenic Dizziness (neck-related) in the context of Headache and Dizziness.

2. Cervicogenic Dizziness (neck-related)

 Dizziness caused by neck problems affects 40% of patients with neck pain. Of these, 59.7% were related to myofascial pain syndrome (muscle tension with trigger points). This often overlaps with cervicogenic headache.

 The neck contains extremely many proprioceptors (position sensors) - especially in the small muscles at the top toward the skull. When these send incorrect signals, a conflict arises between what the neck "tells" the brain and what the balance organ in the ear registers.

 
 Dizziness with head movements

 Neck pain or stiffness

 Often triggered by positions or activities

 SCM trigger points can cause both headache and dizziness

Beskriv symptomer og tegn på nociplastisk smerte for Nociplastisk smerte: Når nervesystemet blir overfølsomt.

Symptomer og tegn på nociplastisk smerte

 Nociplastisk smerte har noen karakteristiske trekk som skiller den fra nociceptiv og nevropatisk smerte.

 Typiske kjennetegn

 Kliniske tegn på sentral sensitisering

 Allodyni: Smerte ved stimuli som normalt ikke er smertefulle (lett berøring, klær mot huden)

 Hyperalgesi: Forsterket smerterespons på smertefulle stimuli

 Utbredt smerte: Smerten sprer seg til flere områder over tid

 Temporal summering: Gjentatt lett stimuli oppleves som stadig mer smertefullt

 Ettersmerte: Smerten vedvarer lenge etter at stimulus er borte

 Andre vanlige symptomer

 Fatigue: Uttalt tretthet som ikke bedres med hvile

 Søvnproblemer: Vansker med innsovning og/eller oppvakninger

 Kognitive vansker: "Hjernetake," konsentrasjonsvansker

 Hodepine: Ofte spenningshodepine eller migrene

 Magesymptomer: Irritabel tarm-lignende symptomer

 Stemningsforandringer: Angst, nedstemmthet

 Misforhold mellom funn og symptomer

 Et viktig kjennetegn

 Ved nociplastisk smerte er det ofte et misforhold mellom objektive funn og symptomenes intensitet . MR og andre undersøkelser viser ingen eller kun minimale forandringer som ikke forklarer graden av smerte og funksjonstap.

 Dette er ikke et tegn på at smerten er innbilt. Det er et tegn på at smerten oppstår i nervesystemets bearbeiding, ikke i vevet som skannes.

Describe causes and risk factors for GTPS.

Causes and Risk Factors

 Compression is the Main Problem

 The gluteal tendons become compressed against the greater trochanter in certain positions and
 movements
 Side-lying - especially on the affected side

 Standing with hip pushed out to the side ("hanging on one hip")

 Crossing legs when sitting

 Walking up stairs or uphill

 Sudden increase in activity - e.g., lots of walking on vacation

 Risk Factors

 Female sex - 4 times higher risk

 Age 40-60 years - hormones and natural aging

 Overweight - increases the load

 Weak hip muscles - lack of stability

 Runners - especially with rapid increase in training volume

 Low back pain - often concurrent problems

 Avoid These Habits

 Lying on the painful side without a pillow between the knees

 Standing with all weight on one leg ("sexy stand")

 Sitting with legs crossed

 Aggressive stretching of the hip

Describe Stages of PTTD for Tibialis Posterior Tendinopathy.

Stages of PTTD

 

 Tibialis posterior tendinopathy is classified into four stages based on severity:

 
 
 
 Stage
 Tendon
 Foot
 Treatment
 
 
 
 
 Stage 1
 Inflammation, normal length
 Normal foot arch, flexible
 Conservative
 
 
 Stage 2
 Lengthened, degenerated
 Flat foot, still flexible
 Conservative/orthotics
 
 
 Stage 3
 Significantly damaged
 Rigid flat foot, not correctable
 Often surgery
 
 
 Stage 4
 Ruptured/non-functional
 Rigid flat foot + ankle arthritis
 Surgery
 
 
 

 
 Why early treatment is important

 Stage 1-2 respond well to conservative treatment. When the condition progresses to stage 3-4, the foot
 deformity becomes permanent and surgery is often necessary. Therefore, early diagnosis and treatment is
 crucial.

Hva er tommelartrose?: Tommelartrose (CMC-1 artrose, basilartrose) er slitasjegikt i leddet ved tommelens rot - der tommelen måter det første mellomhandsbeinet (carpometacarpal-leddet). Dette leddet er spesielt sart fordi det gir tommelen sin unike bevegelighet, men også utsetter det for stor belastning. Tilstanden forveksles noen ganger med De Quervains tenosynovitt eller triggerfinger , som også gir tommelplager.

Årsaker og risikofaktorer: Arvelighet er den desidert viktigste faktoren. Hvis din mor har tommelartrose, er risikoen din betydelig økt.

Symptomer: Forskning viser at 72% av de med røntgenforandringer har ingen symptomer . Slitasje på bildet er normalt med alderen og forklarer ikke alltid smerten du opplever. Behandling bør derfor fokusere på symptomer, ikke røntgenbilder.

Behandling: Tommelortose stabiliserer leddet og reduserer belastning. Kan brukes ved behov eller kontinuerlig.

Symptoms

 The typical course is insidious onset of pain - not an acute event. The pain is felt deep in the groin or
 lower abdomen and worsens with activity. It improves with rest but returns when training resumes.

 Characteristic features

 Deep, aching pain in the groin that worsens with sprinting, kicking, direction changes

 Pain with coughing or sneezing (increased abdominal pressure)

 Vague, diffuse pain that can be difficult to localize precisely

 Radiation to the inner thigh, perineum, or testicles in men

 Morning stiffness after activity

 Loss of function that forces the athlete to reduce or stop activity

 The pain usually starts on one side but can develop on both sides in up to 43% of cases.

Beskriv diagnostikk for Flat Rygg.

Diagnostikk

 Klinisk undersøkelse

 En erfaren kliniker kan ofte se og føle en flat rygg ved undersøkelse. Brystkassen kan virke smal sett fra siden (redusert foran-bak-diameter).

 Røntgen

 For å bekrefte diagnosen brukes stående røntgen av brystryggen. Cobb-vinkel måles fra T4 til T12. Digital måling har høy pålitelighet med ICC >0.99 (PMC, 2019). En vinkel under 20 grader bekrefter hypokyfose.

 Når trengs mer utredning?

 Ved symptomer som brystsmerter, hjertebank eller pustebesvar må hjerte- og lungesykdom utelukkes først. Dette innebører ofte EKG, eventuelt ekkokardiografi, og lungefunksjonstester.

Describe Pregnancy and Lower Back Pain for Lower Back Pain – Complete Guide.

Pregnancy and Lower Back Pain

 

 Go to full article on pregnancy and back pain ?

 Approximately 50% of pregnant women experience lower back pain (Wu et al., European Spine Journal 2004). For some, the problems start early; for others, not until the last trimester.

 
 Why Do Pregnant Women Get Back Pain?

 Hormonal changes:

 
 Relaxin loosens ligaments and joints å provides less stability

 Muscles have to work harder to compensate

 
 Mechanical changes:

 
 Center of gravity shifts forward

 Increased curve in the lower back (hyperlordosis)

 Weight gain of 10–15 kg

 
 

 Types of Pain During Pregnancy

 
 Lumbar pain: Central in the lower back, similar to regular lower back pain

 Pelvic pain: Four times more common. Over the SI joints and/or pubic symphysis.

 Symphysis dysfunction: Pronounced pain over the pubic symphysis, difficulty walking

 

 
 Treatment During Pregnancy

 Chiropractic treatment is safe during pregnancy:

 
 Adapted joint treatment

 Soft tissue therapy

 Pelvic belts for pelvic pain

 Exercises and ergonomic advice

RED-S og kvinnelig idrettstriade

 

 Kvinner har 2-3 ganger høyere risiko for stressfrakturer. En viktig Årsak er RED-S (Relative Energy Deficiency in Sport), tidligere kalt den kvinnelige idrettstriaden.

 
 De tre komponentene

 
 Energimangel: For få kalorier i forhold til aktivitetsnivå

 Menstruasjonsforstyrrelser: Uregelmessig eller fravårende menstruasjon

 Lav beintetthet: Økt risiko for stressfrakturer

 
 

 RED-S kan også ramme menn, spesielt i vektfålsomme idretter. Ved gjentatte stressfrakturer bør man alltid vurdere underliggende Årsaker.

 
 Viktig å vite

 Uteblitt menstruasjon hos kvinnelige utøvere er ikke normalt, selv ved hard trening. Det er et tegn på energimangel og krever oppfølging for å forebygge alvorlige konsekvenser som osteoporose og stressfrakturer.

Forklar Kneartrose for en pasient.

Du har fått beskjed om at du har slitasje i kneet. Kanskje har legen vist deg et røntgenbilde med trange leddsprekker og beinpigger. Du tenker at kneet er "oppbrukt" og at protese er uunngåelig. Knesmerter kan ha mange årsaker, og artrose er bare en av dem.

 Men her er det forskningen faktisk viser: 75% av pasienter med kneartrose kan unngå eller betydelig utsette kneprotese med riktig treningsprogram. Og nei - løping ruinerer ikke kneet ditt. Faktisk har løpere lavere forekomst av kneartrose enn ikke-løpere, selv om mange frykter å utvikle løperkne .

 La oss se på hva artrose egentlig er, og hvorfor trening - ikke hvile - er den mest egnede medisinen.

Explain treatment for Sever's Disease.

Treatment

 The goal of treatment is to reduce pain so that the child can maintain activity. Complete rest is rarely
 necessary.

 What can the chiropractor do?

 Soft tissue treatment

 Loosen tight muscles in the calf and foot

 Joint mobilization

 Ensure good movement in ankle and foot joints

 Taping

 Can provide support and relief during acute periods

 Exercise guidance

 Stretching and strengthening exercises adapted to the child

 What can you do at home?

 Calf stretching

 Important for reducing the pull on the growth plate
 Stand with hands against a wall

 Place the affected leg behind, keep the heel on the floor

 Bend the front knee until you feel a stretch in the calf

 Hold 30 seconds, repeat 3 times

 Do this 2-3 times daily

 Other measures

 Heel cups/insoles: Cushion impact and reduce load

 Ice after activity: 15-20 minutes as needed

 Good shoes: Shock-absorbing shoes with some heel height

 Activity modification: Reduce volume rather than stopping completely

 Activity modification

 Instead of complete rest, modify the activity
 Reduce training volume and intensity

 Avoid hard surfaces when possible

 Switch to low-impact activities during periods (swimming, cycling)

 Let the child take breaks during training when in pain

Hvordan diagnostiseres Hodepine på toppen av hodet?

Diagnostikk

 

 Klinisk undersøkelse er avgjørende

 Diagnostikk av hodepine på toppen av hodet baseres først og fremst på sykehistorie og klinisk undersøkelse. En kiropraktor vil vurdere nakkens bevegelighet, palpere muskulaturen for triggerpunkter, og undersøke Øvre nakkeledd for dysfunksjon.

 Bildediagnostikk

 MR eller røntgen av nakken er sjelden nødvendig ved typiske presentasjoner. Bilder viser ofte normalfunn som slitasje eller degenerative forandringer - funn som er like vanlige hos personer uten smerter og som derfor sjelden forklarer plagene.

Beskriv symptomer og kjennetegn for Vestibularisnevritt.

Symptomer

 

 Symptomene kommer typisk akutt over noen timer, når maksimal intensitet innen 24 timer, og avtar gradvis over dager til uker.

 Typisk symptombilde:

 
 Rotasjonssvimmelhet: Intens følelse av at rommet spinner kontinuerlig

 Spontan nystagmus: Ufrivillige, raske Øyebevegelser som slær mot det friske Øret

 Kvalme og oppkast: Kan vare så uttalt at sykehusinnleggelse er nødvendig

 Balanseproblemer: Tendens til å falle mot den syke siden

 Oscillopsi: Følelse av at synsfeltet "hopper" ved hodebevegelser

 

 
 Viktig diagnostisk poeng

 Vestibularisnevritt gir ikke Hørselstap. Har du svimmelhet kombinert med nedsatt horsel, kan det tyde på labyrinthitt eller andre tilstander som krever annen utredning.

 

 Tidsforløp:

 
 Akuttfase (0-3 dager): Intens svimmelhet, ofte sengeliggende

 Subakutt fase (1-2 uker): Gradvis bedring, kan gå oppreist men blir svimmel ved raske bevegelser

 Kompensasjonsfase (3-12 uker): Hjernen tilpasser seg og lærer å kompensere

 
 De fleste opplever betydelig bedring innen 10 uker.

Beskriv Ofte stilte spørsmål for Kortisoninjeksjon i skulder: Venn eller fiende?.

Ofte stilte spørsmål

 

 
 Hvor lenge varer effekten av en kortisonsprøyte i skulderen?

 Effekten varierer betydelig. Noen opplever lindring i uker til måneder, mens andre har kortvarig eller ingen effekt. Forskning viser at effekten ofte avtar etter 6-8 uker, og ved 3-6 måneder er det ofte ingen forskjell fra placebo.

 

 
 Er kortisoninjeksjoner farlige?

 Enkelte injeksjoner er generelt trygge, men gjentatte injeksjoner kan svekke sener og brusk. Studier viser Økt risiko for seneruptur og forverring av bruskskade ved mange injeksjoner. Anbefalt maksimum er vanligvis 3-4 injeksjoner per område per Ør.

 

 
 Når er kortisonsprøyte i skulderen riktig valg?

 Kortison kan våre nyttig ved akutt, intens betennelse som forhindrer rehabilitering, som et diagnostisk verktøy, eller som et kortvarig tiltak når andre behandlinger ikke har hjulpet. Det bør ikke våre førstevalg ved kroniske senetilstander.

 

 
 Kan kortison gjøre skulderproblemene verre?

 Ja, i noen tilfeller. Kortison kan svekke senevev over tid, og noen opplever en "kortison-flare" med forbigående Økt smerte de første dagene etter injeksjonen. Ved tendinopati kan kortison forstyrre den naturlige helingsprosessen.

 

 
 Hva er alternativene til kortisoninjeksjon?

 Alternativer inkluderer fysioterapi/kiropraktikk med Øvelser, manuell behandling, støtbølgeterapi (ESWT), og for noen tilstander PRP-injeksjoner. Ved mange skuldertilstander er aktiv rehabilitering mer effektivt på lang sikt. Les mer om ergonomi og ...

Beskriv Hvorfor så mange blir feildiagnostisert for Når svimmelheten ikke passer inn: Er det BPPV eller noe annet?.

Hvorfor så mange blir feildiagnostisert

 

 Feildiagnostisering av svimmelhet er utbredt. På akuttmottak blir 74-81% av perifere vestibulære lidelser (inkludert BPPV) oversett.

 Atypiske BPPV-presentasjoner

 37-41% av BPPV-pasienter har ikke klassisk "alt spinner rundt"-opplevelse. Mange beskriver heller:

 
 Nautisk eller vuggende følelse

 Tåkete tankegang ("brain fog")

 Generell ustadighet mellom anfall

 Vedvarende "lett i hodet"-følelse

 

 Diagnostiske tester har begrensninger

 Dix-Hallpike testen for BPPV har kun 48-88% sensitivitet. Negativ test utelukker ikke diagnosen.

 Overlappende tilstander

 Vestibulær migrene og BPPV kan eksistere samtidig. Migrenepasienter har tre ganger høyere BPPV-risiko, og 25% av vestibulær migrene-pasienter rapporterer posisjonssvimmelhet.
You are a clinical documentation specialist for chiropractic. Generate accurate, professional patient explanations using correct medical terminology.
Explain treatment for Morton's Neuroma.

Treatment

 Strong evidence for manual treatment

 Manual treatment represents one of only two interventions with strong evidence for
 Morton's neuroma, according to Matthews' systematic review from 2019.

 79% 
 achieved complete pain relief (VAS 0) within 6 treatments

 What can the chiropractor do?

 1

 Mobilization of midfoot and toe joints

 Restores normal joint movement and reduces compression

 2

 Soft tissue treatment of the forefoot

 Relieves muscle tension and improves circulation

 3

 Guidance on proper footwear

 Wide toe box, low heel (under 3 cm), soft material

 4

 Metatarsal pads

 Placed behind the toe balls to spread the metatarsal bones and relieve the nerve

 What can you do yourself?

 Footwear changes - most important: Shoes with wide toe box that don't squeeze the
 toes together. Remove all shoes with narrow front

 Metatarsal pads: Placed just behind the toe balls (retrocapital position)

 Avoid high heels: Maximum 3 cm heel height

 Realistic expectations

 Pure conservative treatment (footwear + orthotics without injections) succeeds in about
 30-50% . With symptom duration over 4.5 months and neuroma >5-6 mm, orthotics and
 footwear changes alone are rarely sufficient.

 Injection treatment

 Ultrasound-guided cortisone injection can be considered if conservative treatment does not provide
 sufficient effect after 8-12 weeks. However, the long-term effect is limited - at 5-year follow-up,
 injections were still effective in only 36%.

 Surgery

 Considered after at least 6-9 months of failed conservative treatment. Neurectomy provides 74%
 complete pain relief . 72% experience numbness in the supplied toes - this is expected and
 generally does not affect satisfaction.

Patient asks: "Can Eagle syndrome be confused with TMD?"

Yes, Eagle syndrome can produce similar symptoms to TMD, including jaw pain, ear pain and headache. Important differences are that Eagle syndrome often causes pain with swallowing and head rotation, and a palpable hard mass in the tonsil area.

Patient asks: "How long does it take for C5-C6 disc herniation to heal?"

About 85% experience significant improvement within 8-12 weeks with conservative treatment. Most notice progress within 2-4 weeks. Full recovery can take up to 6 months, and the herniation can shrink and be reabsorbed over time.
